name: Meeting Rooms
title: Meeting Rooms
content:
Given an array of meeting time intervals where intervals[i] = [starti, endi], determine if a person could attend all meetings.

 

Example 1:

Input: intervals = [[0,30],[5,10],[15,20]]
Output: false

Example 2:

Input: intervals = [[7,10],[2,4]]
Output: true

 

Constraints:

  • 0 <= intervals.length <= 104
  • intervals[i].length == 2
  • 0 <= starti < endi <= 106

discussion_posts.name: techno_phile
discussion_posts.content: It would\'ve been helpful if they mentioned whether a person could attend a meeting that starts exactly after another meeting ends.

discussion_posts.name: lightserna171
discussion_posts.content: Why is the description so vague? You need to define what overlapping is. This is supposed to be a premium question that we pay for so we should have better descriptions than this.

discussion_posts.name: Joao_Ribeiro
discussion_posts.content: This is a pure "Line Sweep" problem. Why not add "Prefix Sum" and "Line Sweep" tags for this problem? This might help someone coming up with a solution or even find this problem in the list of problems.

discussion_posts.name: bikhilall
discussion_posts.content: Is partial attendance of a meeting counts?

discussion_posts.name: andgorbik
discussion_posts.content: it\'s so annoying, when even for an easy problem such a basic case like intersecting of two intervals is missed in the description

discussion_posts.name: Yitzhakpro
discussion_posts.content: You should add the fact the a person can attend meeting if they are  [0,30] -> [30,60] to the description

discussion_posts.name: matthewjinmp
discussion_posts.content: you\'re definitely going to need to sort by the start time here

discussion_posts.name: shubhammaheshwariy
discussion_posts.content: meeting can start at the end time of another meeting

discussion_posts.name: imahgref
discussion_posts.content: Why is [[13,15],[1,13]] true? i would think 13 overlap and you cant make the meeting

discussion_posts.name: granzort
discussion_posts.content: Trying to understand why empty interval needs to return true logically. For some problems, default results are more predictable than this, or it is given through the notes. If anyone have good logical explanation it would be helpful.\n
